cheatsheet.title: Introduction to Scala using the Worksheet

intro.description: This tutorial will introduce you to the Scala language using the worksheet. A worksheet is a Scala file in which each line is evaluated on save, and the result is displayed to the right of the corresponding expression.

item.title: Open the Scala perspective
item.description: Let's start by switching to the Scala perspective. This brings in all the Scala-related views and menus.

item.title: Create a Scala project
item.description: Next, let's ceate a Scala project. A Scala project holds together related source files, configuration (like classpath and compiler settings). A worksheet always belongs to a project, and inherits the project settings.

item.title: Create a worksheet
item.description: Let's create a worksheet file. By default, the worksheet contains a simple greeting.

item.title: Try out some Scala expressions
item.description:
Start typing inside the given object. Notice that the editor highlights errors as you type, and supports content assist and hyperlinking to definitions.
Try the following:
"Hello, Scala".map(_.toUpperCase)
then hit Save (Ctrl-S)
